<< Contents: Q9a. For each of the following types of debt, please tell us whether it was a new debt for your household in the last six months (since November 2022) or if you already had it before November 2022, and if it has changed in size?

Unnamed: 2: Personal loan from a bank/building society
Unnamed: 3: Personal loan from a payday lender
Unnamed: 4: Buy now pay later / hire purchase
Unnamed: 5: Overdraft (amount you use not max limit)
Unnamed: 6: Credit card (amount owed that you can't repay at the end of the month - not the maximum limit)
Unnamed: 7: Money borrowed from family or friends
Unnamed: 9: Benefit or tax credit overpayments (eg. repaying child tax credit, working tax credit, Universal Credit or housing overpayments)
Unnamed: 10: Personal loan from an unlicensed lender (i.e. a lender providing short term loans at a high cost - sometimes known as a loan shark). This excludes loans from lenders such as banks, authorised doorstep lenders or payday lenders.
Unnamed: 11: Personal loan from an authorised doorstep lender or home credit lender (where you borrow money and the lender calls at your home to collect the repayments)
Unnamed: 12: Loans where personal owned items are put up as collateral in exchange for cash (eg. pawn brokers, cash converters, log book loans)
Unnamed: 13: DWP (Department of Work and Pensions) budgeting advance or budgeting loan
Unnamed: 14: Personal loan from a credit union

<< Contents: This is a new debt in the last six months (since November 2022)
We had this debt before November 2022 and the size of it has increased since November 2022
We had this debt before November 2022 and the size of it has not increased (stayed the same or decreased) since November 2022
Not relevant - do not hold this debt
